channel.title: biology on Chas Nelson
channel.description: Recent content in biology on Chas Nelson

item.title: Event-based Super-resolution Microscopy
item.description: Using novel event-based sensors to improve the speed of super-resolution microscopy. Read more…

item.title: Neuronal Graphs
item.description: Using graph theory and network science to understand the brain. Read more…

item.title: Very Fast Volumetric Microscopy
item.description: Using novel event-based sensors to improve the speed of light sheet fluorescence microscopy for very fast volumetric imaging. Read more…

item.title: Adaptive Prospective Optical Gating
item.description: Developing a smart microscopy system for imaging the beating zebrafish heart over extended periods of time. Read more…

item.title: Automated Nuclei Detection
item.description: Using mathematical techniques to automatically detect and quantify nuclei in 2D and 3D bioimaging data. Read more…

item.title: Imaging the Developing Eye
item.description: Using advanced optics to minimise abberations when imaging the developing zebrafish eye. Read more…

item.title: Object-based Colocalisation
item.description: Using object-based colocalisation to quantify the interactions between protein structures in cellular biology. Read more…

item.title: Quantiative Calcium Imaging
item.description: Investigating volumetric and computational imaging approaches for accurately measuring calcium signals between neurons. Read more…

item.title: 3D Segmentation Techniques
item.description: Using active meshes and level set methods for improved 3D segmentation. Read more…
